member.name: T:DomainContext`2
member.summary: Base class for domain contexts.
member.typeparam: The type of the context interface, used to determine and validate the aggregate roots exposed by the context.
The type of identifiers used by this context aggregate roots (it is be the same for all aggregate roots). Must be a value type or a string.

remarks.para: This context is smart enough to automatically process insert or updates of entire object graphs from aggregate roots. The deeper the graphs and the relationships, the more expensive save operations are, but the behavior is consistent and transparent to the user, and makes modeling domain behavior much easier than dealing with explicit updates of collections and references.

The is used to determine what type are the aggregate roots for the context. All public properties of this interface are considered aggregate roots. All such properties whose T type parameter does not implement the interface compatible with the context parameter cause an exception that is logged at static initialization time.
All entity types tracked by this context must implement , unless they are complex types. This ensures proper updating/deleting behavior for object graphs.

member.name: T:IAggregateRoot`1
member.summary: Base interface that must be implemented by all aggregate root entities.
member.remarks:
This interface simply provides the on top of what provides, enforcing the rule that that aggregate are never deleted using the domain model, they are simply marked as deleted.
Accessing the underlying context implementation though, aggregate roots can be deleted anyway as usual in EF/NH (i.e. in migration scenarios, tests, etc., it might be needed).
